result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam M. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called:  pm
Includes 12CF689, 14CF778, 14CF892.
Clerk: 
Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty John Wallace;

PLEA/SENTECING in 14CF778 and 14CF892:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to: 
14CF778:
Ct. 1 (Felon Possess Firearm-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Carry Concealed Weapon-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-PTAC-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-PTAC-Repeater)>>DRI.

14CF892:
Ct. 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine)>>Delete the Repeater Enhancer and the Second and Subsuquent Offense. 
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
14CF778:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-PTAC-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>NO CONTEST.
Ct. 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine-PTAC-Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

14CF892:
Ct. 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine)>>NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
14CF778:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Covert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-PTAC-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> 8 years WSPS- 5 years IC and 3 years ES. Concurrent to each other and to the Revocation Sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, Maintain Full time Work/Full time Schooling or a combination, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Not eligible for SAP or ERP at this time.

Ct. 3 (Possession of Methamphetamine-PTAC-Repeater)>>7 years WSPS- 5 years IC and 2 years ES. Concurrent to each other and to the Revocation Sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, Maintain Full time Work/Full time Schooling or a combination, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Not eligible for SAP or ERP at this time.

COURT finds 322 days credit.

14CF892:
Ct. 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine)>>10 years WSPS- 5 years IC and 5 years ES. Concurrent to each other and to the Revocation Sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, Maintain Full time Work/Full time Schooling or a combination, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Not eligible for SAP or ERP at this time.

COURT finds 251 days credit.

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION ON 12CF689:

Ct. 2 (2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Repeater-Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>> 10 years WSPS- 5 years IC and 5 years ES. Concurrent to each other and to the Revocation Sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, Absolute sobriety, AODA and follow up, Maintain Full time Work/Full time Schooling or a combination, Court Costs. Not eligible for SAP or ERP at this time.

COURT finds 322 days credit.

COURT will direct JA to contact Attorney Wallace to set matters for trial as soon as possible.
